> What is the best/recommended way to add enhancements to the
> framework's Assert class?


I personnaly like the following approach:

public class MySpecializedAssert extends Assert {
    public static void assertEqual() {
       ...
       if (...)
          fail();
       ...
    }
}

and in your class, you simply use

    public void testMyStuff() {
       MySpecializedAssert.assertEqual(...);
    }

Unlike the "new TestCase" option, you can :
- have multiple assertEqual(Object, Object) methods
- use several user-defined Assert classes in one TestCase object
- easily share your assertions, users don't have to redefine one 
TestCase class to use your assertions (2 classes instead of one)

-Vladimir
